data name.eng_definition: name of the data set, named by data provider

!! material system.eng_definition: selected materials system of the data

affiliation.eng_definition: contibutor's affliation (insitute's name and further definition of working place)

researcher number.eng_definition: contributor’s researcher number ID in Integrated R&D Information System of Korea (https://iris.go.kr)

data generation date.eng_definition: date when the data is added to the present database or data lake

keywords.eng_definition: material type or definition, keywords representing the data set
keywords.data_example: experimental; computational; Li ion battery; carbon nanotube; composite; Al base

embargo.eng_definition: date when allowing open access of the data

classification code.eng_definition: classification code for fields of science and technology announced by Ministry of Science and ICT of KOREA (https://www.law.go.kr/)

related information.eng_definition: Other information on Data; related journals, projects, DOI of data source, etc
related information.data_example: extracted from Acta Mater vol 13, page 2089 (2000); archived on 01/01/2021; 10.1016/j.actamat.2016.08.081; generated in CNMD, POSTECH (2021); funded by KRF 20-12-12345F

material_(n).eng_definition: materials that can be a component of materials system

name.eng_definition: name of materials according to customary usage, designation system, composition, etc.

composition.data_example: {Pt:56.0, Ni:34.7, unit:at.%, uncertainty:0.1}; {Fe2O3:97.8, Y2O3:2.2, unit:wt.%, uncertainty:0.2}

process.eng_definition: material process composed of sequence of synthesis and post processing steps

(process_n).eng_definition: information of nth process, sequentially stored in array
(process_n).data_type: corresponding data module for materials process

model.eng_definition: information of the computation model in the case of compuation or simulation data

phase.eng_definition: major state of the model or major crystal structure when the model is solid

box dimension.eng_definition: dimension parameters of the simulation box. Cubic simulation box is assumed if the angles are not defined.

structure file.eng_definition: link of structure file used for compuation or simulation. File format is determined by extension of the file name

property.eng_definition: attribute, quality, or chracteristic of materials

corrosion property.eng_definition: properties related to deterioration of a material as it reacts with its envirionment via electrochemical and chemical reactions

anodic partial current.eng_definition: sum of all the currents corresponding to anodic reactions on the electrode

cathodic partial current.eng_definition: sum of all the currents corresponding to cathodic electochemical reactions on the electrode

corrosion current.eng_definition: anodic partial current due to metal oxidation

corrosion potential.eng_definition: electrode potential of a metal in a given corrosion system

corrosion rate.eng_definition: amount of corrosion loss per year in thckness

free corrosion current.eng_definition: corrosion current at the free corrosion potential

free corrosion potential.eng_definition: corrosion potential in the absence of net (external) electrical current flowing to or from the metal surface

pasivation potential.eng_definition: corrosion potential, at which the corrosion current has a peak value, and above which there is a range of potentials, where the metal is in a passive state

pasivation current.eng_definition: corrosion current at the passivation potential

pitting initiation potential.eng_definition: the lowest value of the corrosion potential at which pit initiation is possible on a passive surface in a given corrosive environment

redox potential.eng_definition: potential of a reversible oxidation-reduction reaction in a given electrolyte recorded on a S.H.E. scale

re-activation potential.eng_definition: corrosion potential below which reactivation takes place

polarized potential.eng_definition: potential across the electrode/electrolyte interface that is the sum of the corrosion potential and the applied polarization

redox potential (copy).eng_definition: potential of a reversible oxidation-reduction reaction in a given electrolyte recorded on a S.H.E. scale

standard electrode potential.eng_definition: reversible potential for an electrode process when all products and reactants are at unit activity

transpassivation potential.eng_definition: corrosion potential above which the metal is in the transpassive state
